text: Robert James "Bob" Keeshan (June 27, 1927 - January 23, 2004) was an American television producer and actor. He is known for his role as the title character of the children's television program Captain Kangaroo. It became an icon for millions of people during its 30-year run from 1955 to 1984. Keeshan also played the original "Clarabell the Clown" on the Howdy Doody television program. Keeshan died in Windsor, Vermont from a heart attack. He was aged 76. ==References== ==Other websites== * *Biography of Bob Keeshan * Category:1927 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American television presenters Category:American television personalities Category:American entertainers Category:American television actors Category:Actors from New York (state)
title: Bob Keeshan
